official-title.#text:
To provide for the transfer of certain
		  public land currently administered by the Bureau of Land Management to the
		  administrative jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Army for inclusion in White
		  Sands Missile Range, New Mexico, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

action-instruction.#text:
Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert
			 the part printed in italic

committee-name.#tail:
discharged; committed to the Committee of the
			 Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

action-instruction.#text:
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as
			 introduced on March 20, 2013

committee-name.#tail:
discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole
		  House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

short-title.#text:
White Sands Missile Range Security
			 Enhancement Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Transfer of
			 administrative jurisdiction, White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall transfer to the
			 administrative jurisdiction of the

certain public land
			 administered by the

in Dona Ana County, New Mexico,
			 consisting of approximately 5,100 acres depicted as

quote.#text: White Sands Missile Range Land Reservation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall include the land as
			 part of White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico, and authorize use of the land
			 for military purposes.

text.#text:
Upon the receipt of the
			 land under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall publish in the Federal Register a legal description and map
			 of the public land to be transferred under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 have the same force and effect as if included in this Act, except that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:c/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may correct errors in the legal description.

text.#text: The legal description and map filed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be made without reimbursement, except that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for any
			 costs incurred by the

to prepare the legal
			 description and map under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:c
White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall transfer or relocate the grazing allotments associated with the
			 permit or lease to other public land, acceptable to the permit or lease holder,
			 so that the grazing continues to have the same value to the holder.

text.#text:
If a grazing permit or
			 lease exists on the date of the enactment of this Act for any portion of the
			 public land to be transferred under

Nothing in this Act
			 shall be construed—

to establish a
			 reservation in favor of the United States with respect to any water or water
			 right on lands transferred by this Act; or

to authorize the
			 appropriation of water on lands transferred by this Act except in accordance
			 with applicable State law.

This section shall not be
			 construed to affect any water rights acquired or reserved by the United States
			 before the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text:
Effect on previously
			 acquired or reserved water rights

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is withdrawn from all forms of
			 appropriation under the public land laws, including the mining laws and
			 geothermal leasing laws, so long as the lands remain under the administrative
			 jurisdiction of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: White Sands Missile Range Security Enhancement Act/s:2

text.#text:
Subject to valid existing rights, the public
			 land to be transferred under
